intro: Sida pedersenii, commonly known as the Hawaiian sida, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a small, herbaceous annual that grows up to 30 centimeters tall, characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small white flowers. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is adapted to the dry, coastal environments of Hawaii. Its flowers are typically clustered in racemes and bloom from late spring to early summer. Sida pedersenii plays a role in the local ecosystem, providing nectar for native insects and birds.
